text:
any suggestions on how can I use `|>` for `select` with dataframes?
```julia> df = DataFrame(:a => [1, 2], :b => [1, 2])
2×2 DataFrame
 Row │ a      b     
     │ Int64  Int64 
─────┼──────────────
   1 │     1      1
   2 │     2      2

julia> select(df, :a)
2×1 DataFrame
 Row │ a     
     │ Int64 
─────┼───────
   1 │     1
   2 │     2

julia> df |> select(:a)
ERROR: MethodError: no method matching select(::Symbol)
Closest candidates are:
  select(::AbstractDataFrame, ::Any...; copycols, renamecols) at C:\Users\deyan\.julia\packages\DataFrames\oQ5c7\src\abstractdataframe\selection.jl:847
  select(::Union{Function, Type}, ::AbstractDataFrame; renamecols) at C:\Users\deyan\.julia\packages\DataFrames\oQ5c7\src\abstractdataframe\selection.jl:850
  select(::Union{Function, Type}, ::GroupedDataFrame; copycols, keepkeys, ungroup, renamecols) at C:\Users\deyan\.julia\packages\DataFrames\oQ5c7\src\groupeddataframe\splitapplycombine.jl:642
  ...
Stacktrace:
 [1] top-level scope
   @ REPL[15]:1

julia> ```

elements.text: any suggestions on how can I use

julia> df = DataFrame(:a => [1, 2], :b => [1, 2])
2×2 DataFrame
 Row │ a      b     
     │ Int64  Int64

   2 │     2      2

julia> select(df, :a)
2×1 DataFrame

     │ Int64 
─────┼───────

   2 │     2

julia> df |> select(:a)
ERROR: MethodError: no method matching select(::Symbol)
Closest candidates are:
  select(::AbstractDataFrame, ::Any...; copycols, renamecols) at C:\Users\deyan\.julia\packages\DataFrames\oQ5c7\src\abstractdataframe\selection.jl:847
  select(::Union{Function, Type}, ::AbstractDataFrame; renamecols) at C:\Users\deyan\.julia\packages\DataFrames\oQ5c7\src\abstractdataframe\selection.jl:850
  select(::Union{Function, Type}, ::GroupedDataFrame; copycols, keepkeys, ungroup, renamecols) at C:\Users\deyan\.julia\packages\DataFrames\oQ5c7\src\groupeddataframe\splitapplycombine.jl:642
  ...
Stacktrace:
 [1] top-level scope
   @ REPL[15]:1

julia>

text:
The |> operator pushes the lhs into a single argument function. So your example would only work if select(:a) returned a function.

What you probably want is the Chain.jl or Pipe.jl package

elements.text:
The |> operator pushes the lhs into a single argument function. So your example would only work if select(:a) returned a function.

What you probably want is the Chain.jl or Pipe.jl package

text:
Chain.jl in particular will give you a workflow like

@chain df begin
    select(:a)  # df is the implicit first argument
    unique
    groupby(:b)
end

elements.text:

    select(:a)  # df is the implicit first argument
    unique
    groupby(:b)
end

text: thank you! I'll check these out
